data.name: rampAtlas
data.description: Code used to retrieve, organize, and analyze data for the Ramp Atlas

evidence: "This repository is intended to make publicly available all code and accompanying scripts that were used to retrieve, organize, and analyze data for the Ramp Atlas."

Multiple Python scripts are described as end-user tools with specified inputs/outputs for data analysis (e.g., "*geneAndRampTotal.py* input: Ramp Presence CSV output: total counts of genes and ramps per tissue and cell type, useful for dataset-wide chi-squared tests and pairwise z-tests").

The README only describes code organized in directories and scripts, with no mention of package managers, containers, or binaries, implying use via cloning the repository and running scripts from source.
